alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 4:40AM CDT until August 22 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Denton and Tarrant. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Irving, Denton, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Euless, Grapevine, Keller, Coppell, Hurst, Southlake, Watauga, Colleyville, Corinth, Highland Village, Trophy Club, Lake Dallas, Eagle Mountain, North Richland Hills and Roanoke.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
